entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 8 - The Pointy End (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 8 - The Pointy End (2)20160623
Syrio's final scene with Arya was pretty awesome. It is a very
natural way that she becomes independent and starts off her own
journey. Varys is such a complicated guy, but I suppose that my
problem is that I'm looking for heroes. It is really epic the way
the hordes of ravens leave Winterfell. It's interesting that
there is another occurrence of a White Walker. Dany's made such a
huge mistake in this episode that is going to totally change
everything about her life. In many ways, it's similar to the
problems she will cause for herself in Slaver's Bay: disrupting
the old ways caused problems. Joffrey is such a little punk.

I was very curious about why Alliser is such a jerk to Jon
Snow. Apparently the novels reveal that he was a Targaryen
supporter that was forced to the Wall after Robert's Rebellion.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 9 - Baelor (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 9 - Baelor (2)20160623
Frey is such a creeper. I think it is very interesting how Aemon
related his experience to Jon. Shae is very cute with
Tyrion. Tyrion's story about his marriage was very sad. It is
very neat that Jaime is now captured. It is very cool how
Eddard's first thought it how to protect Arya. In yet another
tragic moment, if only Eddard would have chosen honor at this
moment, he could have caused problems for the Lannisters and
eventually helped Robb as he was going to die anyway. My wife was
totally surprised by Ned dying.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 10 - Fire and Blood (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 10 - Fire and Blood (2)20160623
Arya's story is getting very interesting. I like how clever Yoren
is and how he is so adamant that Arya is a boy. Joffrey is such a
punk. Tywin is such a strange character at this point and it is
very exciting to wonder what Tyrion will do as Hand. The scene
with Ros and Pycelle was so weird. I really liked the
conversation between *REDACTED*t and Snow, as it does a great job
reminding us about what is really at stake. Dragons!

From the wiki... it is interesting to know that it has only been
300 years since the North was not independent. It's interesting
to learn that Varys was who arranged for Yaren to help Arya,
Gendry, and Ned.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 7 - You Win or You Die (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 7 - You Win or You Die (2)20160622
Cersei is so much colder than Eddard. It is interesting because
what happened with Bronn in the last episode foreshadowed this:
the one that fought with honor died. Eddard is such a tragic
hero, because he is doing the right thing but will not
win. Jorah's actions were great. Jon's realization that the world
is unfair is turning point for his character. The Night Watch's
oath is epic. Drogo's promise is great. It seems amazing that
Littlefinger betrayed Eddard, but I think it represents his
survival instinct against the Lannisters. He will fight them in
his own way later. Also, he loves Catelyn, not Eddard.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 4 - Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 4 - Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things (2)20160621
It was a pretty epic moment when Dany realized that Viserys was
useless. I like Tyrion even more remembering his old style. I
like Jon's honorable treatment of Ros. Catelyn's handling of
Tyrion at the Inn was totally epic.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 5 - The Wolf and the Lion (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 5 - The Wolf and the Lion (2)20160621
The revelation of Varys planning and cooperating with the
Targaryens is very interesting. Eddard's honor is great. It's
very annoying that he only got hurt because of
Littlefinger. Arya's entrance back into the city was great.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 6 - A Golden Crown (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 6 - A Golden Crown (2)20160621
Osha and the other wildlings look so weird. Tyrion's trial was
great. I especially like how he "paid his debts". Dany's scene
with the heart was rad. I understand why the boy was to be named
Rhaego.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 1 - Winter Is Coming (3)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 1 - Winter Is Coming (3)20160620
We watched this on VidAngel. It was pretty awesome. It is very
cute to see what the characters are like in the beginning. Theon,
in particular, is very different. It was cool to see Hodor in the
first scene as the king came. Dany's scenes are interesting
because she is so weak at this stage.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 2 - The Kingsroad (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 2 - The Kingsroad (2)20160620
I really like how Jon has such high expectations for the Night's
Watch. I like that Dany's only pleasure seems to be the dragon
eggs. Joffrey is such a little punk. Ugh. Tyrion is so clever and
wise in his advice right away. It's interesting to think that
this is the last time many characters will ever see each other.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 3 - Lord Snow (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 3 - Lord Snow (2)20160620
Ugh, Joffrey is so terrible. Arya's scenes are awesome. I really
liked Old Nan's stories to Bran. I don't understand why Catelyn
went to King's Landing. Tyrion's advice to Jon was great. Dany's
scene with Viserys is awesome.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 6 - Episode 9 - Battle of the Bastards
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 6 - Episode 9 - Battle of the Bastards20160620
Dany was clearly in top form, which was great. I expected to have
the meeting with Yara have more to it, but it was still
cool. Jon's battle was pretty epic, although it was so stupid of
him, of course. Sansa was obviously very right. I'm surprised
that Littlefinger didn't have any lines, although I expect
something exciting will happen with him soon. Sansa is definitely
a very different person than she was in King's Landing.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game: Lucky's Tale (Rift, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: Lucky's Tale (Rift, 2016)20160619
I played through the first level of this. It was very fun, but
mostly for the novelty. It was a totally vanilla platformer, like
Mario 64 (i.e. not like Super Mario 3D World) but it was
definitely enjoyable. The novelty of the 3D worked great. I felt
like after the one level, though, I felt a little bit dizzy and
couldn't go on. I would like to continue playing it.

Total time: 0:25
  • Video Games
  • Lucky's Tale
  • Rift
  • 2016

entry.title: Movie: Rush, starring Chris Hemsworth and Daniel Bruhl (2013) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Rush, starring Chris Hemsworth and Daniel Bruhl (2013) (2)20160619
We watched this together and found it to be really cool. There were
lots of needless boobs and a few people were annoying vulgar in
their language, but the overall feel and story of the movie was
great.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Fight Club, starring Edward Norton (1999)
entry.content:
Movie: Fight Club, starring Edward Norton (1999)20160617
We watched this on Vidangel, because we had a free movie and wanted
to try it out on something. My wife thought of this one because
she's heard so much about it and never saw it. It was definitely
very cool. I thought the editing was really sloppy and
annoying. They just cut out parts of the audio so it was totally
silent, and if there was something visual that was cut, then the
entire movie was cut at that point. The cuts were also not perfect,
so sometimes you didn't get the audio around the F-word. From my
perspective, it was also dumb because you always knew what the word
was (lip-reading, etc) so I heard them all in my head.
  • Movies
  • 1999

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 6 - Episode 8 - No One
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 6 - Episode 8 - No One20160613
Of course I was right that the theater lady helped Arya, that was
a bit obvious. I expected her to last longer though. I thought it
was cool how Brienne and Jaime talked. Cersei's situation is
pretty rough. The scene of jokes was very silly, but cute. Dany
is baaaack! Arya's escape and fight was so epic. Naturally she
has turned her temporary blindness into a super power.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Movie: Super, starring Rainn Wilson (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: Super, starring Rainn Wilson (2010)20160613
This was a really gruesome and "real" movie. From the intro
sequence and the weird vision of God, I thought he was really going
to get super powers. Instead, it was a very raw movie. In many ways
it was like Kickass, except that that movie was very "fun" and had
a lot of fantasy in it. This is, of course, a fantasy, but it
attempts to have as little as possible with very little
glamour. The end of the movie was very tragic and sad. Interesting
one...
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi, directed by Michael Bay (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi, directed by Michael Bay (2016)20160613
This was a very intense movie. I like the way the CIA people came
around to respect the soldiers protecting them. I really liked the
last line of "I don't know how you guys made it last night, but I
know how we did" and "I'm proud to know Americans like you."

It is a conflicting experience, watching this. I'm totally opposed
to the US being involved in things like this, but I have great
respect and admiration for the soldiers. My perspective is that the
CIA and politicians that send them around the world are terrible,
but that they are great.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.title: Movie: Children of Men, starring Clive Owen (2006)
entry.content:
Movie: Children of Men, starring Clive Owen (2006)20160613
This was a very weird movie. I thought it would be much more
sci-fi, but instead it was just very grim and political. It was
extremely tense.
  • Movies
  • 2006

entry.title: Movie: Pride and Prejudice and Zombies, starring Lily James (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Pride and Prejudice and Zombies, starring Lily James (2016)20160612
This was an excellent movie. I had very low expectations, but it
had lots of very clever moments and ideas in it. I had a lot of fun
with it. I think I would actually watch it again maybe, it was so
weird.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.title: Movie: Zoolander 2, starring Ben Stiller (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Zoolander 2, starring Ben Stiller (2016)20160611
This was a very silly movie. It definitely requires you to have
seen the previous movie to really understand it, so in that sense
it is not as good. But it is pretty ridiculous in a good way. I
doubt I'd ever watch it again and I probably won't think about it,
but there were some very funny gags.
  • Movies
  • 2016
